title: If we made an atom that was big enough to see, what would it look like? - Quora

response.answer_text: You wouldn’t see the electrons; they have no particular location. Just probability. And since they are point-like, they seem to have no size, only charge and you can’t directly see electricity. The nucleus would be a tiny structure, 1/1000th the size of the atom. If your eyes were good enough, the structure of the nucleus would be like writhing/vibrating ‘ping-pong’ balls. But none of this is true! The atom is a quantum creature and could not exist as you described.
